As editor of the Pall Mall Gazette , Morley gave staunch support to William Gladstone and his government that had come to power following the 1880 General Election . As well as parliamentary reform , Morley was a staunch supporter of Irish Home Rule . With the help of two political allies, Joseph Chamberlain and Charles Dilke, Morley was given the safe Liberal seat of Newcastle . After being elected to the House of Commons in 1883, Morley handed over the editorship of the Pall Mall Gazette to his able deputy, William Stead . However, he continued to edit the journal, Macmillans''s Magazine , until being appointed by William Gladstone as Irish Secretary in 1885.
